components.description:
A single date on a calendar. Generally depicted as a page torn off from a daily desk calendar, displaying month and day on a white, square page.

Like ğŸ“† Tear-Off Calendar and ğŸ—“ï¸ Spiral Calendar, commonly used as an icon for specific upcoming events or memorial dates. Also used for various content concerning time, date, schedules, planning, and observances and occasions more generally.

The date shown is July 17. This date was first used by Apple as a reference to when iCal for Mac premiered at MacWorld Expo in 2002. Since 2014 Emojipedia has celebrated World Emoji Day on July 17, because of this emoji.

Major platforms previously used a variety of dates on this calendar, but have changed in recent years to also show July 17, to avoid confusion on World Emoji Day. Some vendors still feature easter egg dates marking company founding or other milestones:

  • ğŸ“… Apple: July 17 (Mac iCal announcement in 2002, later World Emoji Day)
  • ğŸ“… Google: July 17 (World Emoji Day; previously a generic monthly calendar)
  • ğŸ“… Microsoft: a generic month
  • ğŸ“… Samsung: July 17 (World Emoji Day; previously a monthly calendar turned to May)
  • ğŸ“… WhatsApp: Feb 24 (incorporation of WhatsApp in 2009)
  • ğŸ“… Twitter/X: Jul 17  (changed from March 21 which was the founding date of Twitter in 2006; previously July 15, the date Twitter launched)
  • ğŸ“… Facebook: May 14 (birthday of founder Mark Zuckerberg; previously a generic 3rd)
  • ğŸ“… Huawei: September 15
  • ğŸ“… JoyPixels: July 17 (World Emoji Day)
  • ğŸ“… SerenityOS: 10

Discontinued:

  • ğŸ“… Messenger: August (first release of Messenger apps in 2011)
  • ğŸ“… LG: Mar 27 (unknown)
  • ğŸ“… HTC: generic
  • ğŸ“… Mozilla: July 17 (World Emoji Day)
  • ğŸ“… emojidex: Tuesday, Jan 12 (unknown)
  • ğŸ“… Softbank: generic
  • ğŸ“… Docomo: 12 (suggesting the number of months in a year)  
  • ğŸ“… au by KDDI: 12
components.title: Calendar

title: Calendar

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Office symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A calendar, which may feature a single date, or a month-view calendar. Not to be confused with the Tear-Off Calendar. The date displays July http://emojipedia.org/calendar/
emoji_net_data.name: calendar

bn:00093336v: Plan for an activity or event

bn:00014705n: An application or tool in the form of an electronic calendar, commonly used for scheduling.
A calendar is a system of organizing days for social, religious, commercial or administrative purposes.
System of organizing days for social, religious, commercial, or administrative purposes.
A system of timekeeping that defines the beginning and length and divisions of the year
The link to the online calendar on Windows Live Calendar.

bn:00001967n: A temporally organized plan for matters to be attended to
A temporally organized plan for matters to be attended to.
